text: Hey guys, just checking in with everyone. How is the learning going?
also i think our user stories are too general
shouldnt they be more on the lines of,  As a teacher, I was to see the number of students that answered for each multiple choice.
I cant access our github
gimme 2 sec
aight

I feel like you're right on the fact that our stories are not precise enough, sice they're supposed to explain features accuratly, so on the teacher side, i feel like we could put the one that you wrote instead of #2
#1 and #3 are kinda iffy, since they dont explicitly explain a feature of our project
what do you guys think?
yeah i agree
Like I think that the user story should correlate directly to a feature

what feature do we want to implement? I can think of
Teacher side: 
1- The teacher is able to ask question during class
2- The teacher can see stats about his class attendances
3- the teacher can see basic stats about the students answer
Student side:
1-The ablility to show attendance
2- The ability to answer question (anonymously?)
I agree
How many features do we need to have?
cause if we list all the feature that we want
as many as u want to build lol
doesnt the teacher want a certain amount of user stories?
good question
also im not exactly sure how we would keep track of student attendance if we dont have a login
oh also, as a teacher,, I want each student to be able to only answer once
also, as a teacher I would like to implement a time limit
as a student I would like to be able to change my answer

those are good.

But if we want a timer, a counter and stuff, wouldnt that require a server?
The timer can be done in Javascript, no need for a server
how about the counter, to take care of attendance?
If it cant be done without any kind of server side operation, do we cut this feature?
